page.title: 05Housing in Wendover
page.content: The older buildings in Wendover, apart from the 13th century church, are in the centre of the village. The High Street has many examples of half-timbered houses, some sympathetically adapted as shops. In Tring Road is a row of heavily thatched cottages built around the 1600s. Along the Aylesbury Road, houses with earlier building characteristics display a range of 18th century frontages. Many houses in the village date from the late 19th century period but there is evidence of modern in-filling. After slow growth before World War II, the village has undergone considerable development in the last 40 years mainly through the building of a Council Estate and speculative private building. Prices in this favoured area range from 30,000 pounds to 180,000 pounds.
